item.title: More to Life than Being Happy
item.author: kc0bfv@notmet.net (Karl Sickendick)
item.description: This article in the Atlantic struck a chord with me. It’s about how, in life, searching for meaning can leave people more satisfied than searching for happiness. As [Viktor Frankl] saw in the [concentration] camps, those who found meaning even in the most horrendous circumstances were far more resilient to suffering than those who did not. “Everything can be taken from a man but one thing”. Meaning, more than happiness, is long-term.
